title.en: Internal Medicine Propaedeutics (Part of Fundamentals of Diagnostics)

50406 Tartu linn,

EST

title.en: Medical History of the Internal Medicine Patient

description.en: During the course students learn performing clinical examination of patients as well as to find major changes in the results of laboratory and instrumental examinations, obtain skills to present and write down the results of examinations. This is a part of the course of Fundamentals of diagnostics.
description.et: Kursuse raames õpitakse haige üldist füüsikalist läbivaatust, õpitakse tundma suuremaid haiguslikke muutusi enamkasutatavates laboratoorsete ja instrumentaalsete uuringute tulemustes, omandatakse oskus kanda ette ning vormistada kirjalikult uuringute tulemused. Tegemist on ühe osaga Diagnostika alustest.

objectives.en: To obtain the skills of physical examination as well as interpreting major pathological changes.
objectives.et: Omandada haige füüsikalise läbivaatuse oskused, samuti suuremate haiguslike muutuste esialgne interpretatsioon.

learning_outcomes.en: The students who have successfully passed the course
1) know the basic terminology of clinical medicine
2) know the different diagnostic methods used in practice
learning_outcomes.et: 2) teavad praktikas kasutatavaid erinevaid diagnoosimise meetodeid

learning_outcomes.en: 3) orientate in the theoretical and ethical principles of the doctor-patient relationship
learning_outcomes.et: 3) orienteeruvad arsti-haige suhte teoreetilistes alustes ja eetilistes printsiipides.

learning_outcomes.en: 4) are able to interview the patients
5) are able to perform clinical physical examination of patients and to find major pathological changes
learning_outcomes.et: 5) oskavad teha haige üldise füüsikalise läbivaatuse ja leida suuremad haiguslikud muutused

learning_outcomes.en: 6) are able to interprete data from medical history and major findings of physical examination
learning_outcomes.et: 6) oskavad interpreteerida anamneesist saadud andmeid ja suuremaid haige läbivaatusel kindlaks tehtud muutusi

learning_outcomes.en: 7) know the diagnostic possibilities of the most widely used laboratory and instrumental examinations
learning_outcomes.et: 7) teavad enamkasutatavate laboratoorsete ja instrumentaalsete uuringute diagnostilisi võimalusi

learning_outcomes.en: 8) are able to present and write down the medical history and results of physical examination
learning_outcomes.et: 8) oskavad kanda ette ning vormistada kirjalikult haige anamneesi ning objektiivse uurimise tulemused

description.et:
Eksam sooritatakse kompleksaine Diagnostika alused raames. Sisehaiguste propedeutika osa positiivseks hindamiseks on vajalik koguda vähemalt 61% võimalikest punktidest.

The exam is a part of the complex subjekt of Basics of diagnostics. For the positive mark the student should get at least 61% level of the possible points

A= 93-100%
B= 85 - 92%
C= 77 - 84 %
D= 69 - 76%
E= 61 - 68%
F= 0 - 60%

Haige uurimise lugu vormistatakse anamneesi ja objektiivse uuringu tulemusel kirjalikult. Haige uurimise loo arvestuse sooritamine on eelduseks eksamile lubamisele.

Patient examination report is based on taking full history and clinical examination of the patient. Positive mark of the patient examination report is a precondition to be allowed to the written examination

grade_preconditions.et: Osalemine praktikumides, mõjuval põhjusel võib jääda 1 praktikum puudutuks.

grade_evaluation.et:
Eksamihinne kujuneb Diagnostika aluste komplekseksamil. Eksamile lubatakse positiivselt praktiliste oskuste arvestuse sooritanud ning positiivseks hinnatud haige uurimise loo esitanud tudengid.
Sisehaiguste propedutika osa hindamine: kuni 27 p. kirjalik eksamitöö, kuni 13 p. praktiliste oskuste arvestus, kuni 5 p. haige uurimise lugu

debt_elimination.et:
Kokkuleppel õppejõuga enne semestri lõppu.
In agreement with the professor before the end of the semester.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et: 1.	Propedeutics of internal medicine, basic terminology. Methods of diagnosis. (Pre-recorded lecture)
2.	General patient examination. General status, inspection, palpation, percussion, auscultation. (Pre-recorded lecture)
4.	Examination of the respiratory system. (Pre-recorded lecture)
5.	Examination of the cardiovascular system (Pre-recorded lecture)
6.	Examination of the gastrointestinal system. (Pre-recorded lecture)
7.	Examination of the bones, joints, muscles and peripheral nervous system (Pre-recorded lecture)
8.	Examination of kidneys and urinary tract. (Pre-recorded lecture)
9.	Examination of the hematological and endocrine system. (Pre-recorded lecture)

1.	General examination of a patient. Examination room. Equipment. Examination of haematopoietic organs and the endocrine system. 
2.	Examination of chest organs: respiratory system (demonstration + practising on fellow students)
3.	Examination of the respiratory system in patients.
4.	Examination of chest organs: cardiovascular system (demonstration + practising on fellow students)
5.	Examination of the cardiovascular system in patients.
6.	Examination of chest organs in patients.
7.	Patient safety, ethical tasks, ECG. Self-directed learning in Moodle.
8.	Examination of the abdominal region.
9.	Examination of the bones, joints, muscles, and peripheral nervous system.
10.	Examination of the prostate and mammary glands (on technical models). Palpation of the bladder and kidneys.
11.	Assessment of patient examination skills.
12.	Discussion of patient examination reports
